lead_paragraph: By acting against two dissident lawmakers, Beijing is asserting an authority to set policy in the territory, challenging its semiautonomous status.

byline.contributor: Alan Wong contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Elected Two Separatists. China Took Drastic Action.
headline.main: Hong Kong Elected 2 Separatists. China Took Drastic Action.

snippet: By acting against two dissident lawmakers, Beijing is asserting an authority to set policy in the territory, challenging its semiautonomous status....
abstract: Decision by China to intervene in Hong Kong court case and block activists Sixtus Leung and Yau Wai-ching, newly elected members of legislature, from taking office signals that Pres Xi Jinping's government will asset new authority to set policy in former British colony; move could damage territory's reputation and could imperil its status as international trade and finance hub.
